page.title: 06CHRISTS HOSPITAL ARTS CENTRE
page.content: THE{ARTS CENTRE}WAS BUILT IN 1974.IT HAS OCTAGONAL FEATURES WHICH LINK IT ARCHITECTURALLY TO THE SCHOOL.IT WAS ORIGINALLY BUILT AS A THEATRE FOR THE SCHOOL BUT WAS OPENED FOR PUBLIC USE. THERE ARE TWO FULLTIME AND TWO PARTIME WORKERS.THERE ARE 500 SEATS IN THE THEATRE.THEY HAVE HAD FIVE GROUPS THAT ARE FAMOUS, INCLUDING THE KING'S SINGERS AND KENT OPERA. THEY ARE OPEN 36 WEEKS A YEAR. THEIR AUDIENCE COMES FROM UP TO 50 MILES AROUND. THEY ARE OPEN FROM 8:30 AM TILL 10:30 PM. THE LONGEST ENTERTAINMENT THEY HAVE DONE IS FOR THREE AND A HALF HOURS. THE SHORTEST IS ONE HOUR. THEY DO PLAYS FOR CHARITY. IT COSTS Â£1.50 TO Â£4.50 FOR A SEAT. THE BULDING WAS MADE OF WOOD, BRICKS AND GLASS.IT TOOK TWO YEARS TO BUILD.
